thread.title: Arsenal news: Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy takes swipe at Arsenal over stadium | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy takes swipe at Arsenal over stadium | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy takes swipe at Arsenal over stadium | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 28 Feb 2017 1:30 am Daniel Levy aimed a subtle dig at Arsenal over Spurs’ new stadium. (AFP/Getty Images) 
Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy has aimed a dig at Arsenal by claiming that Spurs’ new ground will be a better place for fans than the Emirates Stadium. 
Spurs are planning to move into their 61,000-capacity stadium for the the 2018-19 season. 
The new ground – which is yet to be named – will have 568 more seats than the Emirates Stadium, making it the biggest club stadium in London. 
The total cost of the move is around £750 million. Construction at White Hart Lane is already under way. (Getty Images)
